title: Spack determine runtime and linking dependencies from build
body:
Spack is being considered to help build and run supercomputing software ecosystems within a container.  Recently, Docker has added the capability of multistage builds in composing Dockerfiles, which could be a good fit in constructing container images which only have the necessary toolkits to execute a given HPC app or task, rather than the full build-time requirements.   In this, it would be ideal to have a Spack command which returns a delimited list of the link and runtime requirements for the currently built stack. 

Instead of a list, perhaps this should export a set of binary files that Spack can install directly? 
NOTE: flexible on specific Spack syntax.

### Rationale
This capability will allow for container builds to most effectively leverage Spack for controlling build and  run-time container images.  The result would be a container with only the minimal running environment necessary.


### Description
Example Dockerfile:
```
#BUILD container
FROM toss-3.3:x86_64 as build
...
RUN apt-get install foo
RUN spack install bar zlib
...
WORKDIR /mybuilddir
COPY myapp_source.tar.gz
RUN ./configure && make 
RUN spack get-runtime >> /spack/spack_runtimes_deps.txt

#RUNTIME container
FROM toss_minimal:latest 
RUN apk --no-cache add ca-certificates
COPY --from=build /spack/spack_runtimes_deps.txt
RUN spack install <<  /spack/spack_runtimes_deps.txt

WORKDIR /opt/myapp
COPY --from=build /mybuilddir/app .
CMD ["./opt/myapp/app"]  

```

### Additional information

Multi-stage builds:  https://docs.docker.com/develop/develop-images/multistage-build/
